clinical_study.brief_title: A Trial of TTI-622 in Patients With Advanced Hematologic Malignancies
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1a/1b Dose-Escalation and Expansion Trial of TTI-622 in Patients With Advanced Hematologic Malignancies, Including Lymphoma, Leukemia, and Multiple Myeloma

brief_summary.textblock: Multicenter, open-label, phase 1a/1b Dose Escalation and Expansion Trial of TTI-622 in subjects with Advanced Hematologic Malignancies, Including Lymphoma, Leukemia, and Multiple Myeloma.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a trial of TTI-622 in subjects with relapsed or refractory lymphoma or multiple myeloma (MM) and subjects with newly diagnosed acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
This trial will be conducted in 2 phases: Phase 1a (Dose-Escalation Phase for Single-Agent TTI-622) and Phase 1b (TTI-622 Combinations).
In the Dose-Escalation Phase for Single-Agent TTI-622, subjects with relapsed or refractory lymphoma will be enrolled in sequential dose cohorts.
In the Combination Treatment part, subjects will be included in 1 of 3 cohorts: (1) subjects with newly diagnosed TP53-mutated AML will be treated with TTI-622 + azacitidine; (2) elderly subjects (â‰¥75 years old) or subjects unfit for intensive induction chemotherapies with newly diagnosed TP53-wildtype AML will be treated with TTI-622 + azacitidine and venetoclax; and (3) subjects with relapsed or refractory MM will be treated with TTI-622 + carfilzomib and dexamethasone.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Frequency and severity of adverse events (AEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 18 months
primary_outcome.description: To characterize the safety profile (incidence of AEs) and dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) of TTI-622.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1b: Frequency and severity of AEs
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 18 months
primary_outcome.description: To characterize the safety profile (incidence of AEs).

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1b: Efficacy of each combination treatment
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 18 months
primary_outcome.description: To evaluate preliminary efficacy (response rate) of each combination treatment in the 3 Cohorts (A to C).

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Characterize the TTI-622 pharmacokinetics (PK) parameter t1/2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize t1/2 of TTI-622.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Characterize the TTI-622 PK parameter AUC0-t
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize AUC0-t of TTI-622.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Characterize the TTI-622 PK parameter AUC0-tau

secondary_outcome.description: To characterize AUC0-tau of TTI-622.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Characterize the TTI-622 PK parameter AUC0-infinity
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize AUC0-infinity of TTI-622.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Characterize the TTI-622 PK parameter Tmax
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize Tmax of TTI-622.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Characterize the TTI-622 PK parameter Cmax

secondary_outcome.description: To characterize Cmax of TTI-622.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Characterize the TTI-622 PK parameter Cmin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize Cmin of TTI-622.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Characterize the TTI-622 PK parameter Cavg
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize Cavg of TTI-622.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Characterize the clearance of TTI-622
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through study completion, up to 18 months
secondary_outcome.description: To characterize clearance of TTI-622.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1a: Characterize the volume of distribution of TTI-622

arm_group.arm_group_label: Cohort B: TTI-622 + Azacitidine and Venetoclax
Cohort C: TTI-622 + Carfilzomib and Dexamethasone

intervention.description: TTI-622 will be administered by intravenous infusion.
intervention.arm_group_label: Cohort B: TTI-622 + Azacitidine and Venetoclax
Cohort C: TTI-622 + Carfilzomib and Dexamethasone

intervention.description: 75 mg/m^2 intravenous (IV) or subcutaneous (SC) daily for 7 days, repeated every 4 weeks
intervention.arm_group_label: Cohort B: TTI-622 + Azacitidine and Venetoclax

intervention.description: 400 mg orally daily for each day of each cycle (except for Cycle 1, where Day 1=100 mg and Day 2=200 mg; first 7 doses taken in clinic). The ramp-up and target dose of venetoclax will be adjusted per the package insert in subjects who are taking concomitant moderate or strong CYP3A4 inhibitors or posaconazole
intervention.arm_group_label: Cohort B: TTI-622 + Azacitidine and Venetoclax

intervention.description: Days 1, 8, and 15 of 28-day cycles; 20 mg/m^2 IV given on Cycle (C) 1 Day (D) 1, and if tolerated, then 70 mg/m^2 IV given starting on C1D8 and subsequent doses thereafter
intervention.arm_group_label: Cohort C: TTI-622 + Carfilzomib and Dexamethasone

intervention.description: 40 mg orally or IV on Days 1, 8, 15, and 22 of 28-day cycles
intervention.arm_group_label: Cohort C: TTI-622 + Carfilzomib and Dexamethasone

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria (Phase 1a and Phase 1b, all Cohorts):
1. Available fresh or archived tumor tissue.
2. Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status score of 0, 1, or 2.
3. Adequate coagulation function.
4. Adequate hepatic function.
5. Adequate hematologic status.
6. Adequate renal function.
7. Recovery from non-hematopoietic toxicities of previous anticancer drugs or radiotherapy or previous surgeries to â‰¤Grade 1 (or to baseline grade if condition was pre-existing).
Key Inclusion Criteria (Phase 1a): Histologically confirmed relapsed/refractory lymphoma (Hodgkin or non-Hodgkin).
Key Inclusion Criteria (Phase 1b Cohort A): Histologically confirmed, newly diagnosed TP53-mutated Acute Myeloid Leukemia (AML).
Key Inclusion Criteria (Phase 1b Cohort B): Histologically confirmed, newly diagnosed TP53-wildtype AML, elderly or unfit for more aggressive treatment.
Inclusion Criteria (Phase 1b Cohort C): Histologically documented relapsed/refractory Multiple Myeloma (MM).
Key Exclusion Criteria (Phase 1a and Phase 1b, all Cohorts):
1. Known, current central nervous system disease involvement.
2. Use of any investigational agent or any anticancer drug within 14 days before planned start of study treatment (within 4 weeks for antibody-based therapies and within 8 weeks for cell-based therapies).
3. Subjects who have undergone radiation therapy within 14 days of study treatment administration.
4. Hematopoietic stem cell transplant within 90 days before the planned start of study treatment or subjects with active graft-vs-host disease, with the exception of Grade 1 skin involvement.
5. Major surgery within 30 days before planned start of study treatment.

facility.name: Sarah Cannon Research Institute at Colorado Blood Cancer Institute (CBCI)
University of TN Medical Center/Cancer Institute
